inputFields.name: gradingPeriodId
inputFields.description:
only return assignments for the given grading period. Defaults to
the current grading period. Pass `null` to return all assignments
(irrespective of the assignment's grading period)

fields.name: assignmentsConnection
fields.description:
returns a list of assignments.

**NOTE**: for courses with grading periods, this will only return grading
periods in the current course; see `AssignmentFilter` for more info.
In courses with grading periods that don't have students, it is necessary
to *not* filter by grading period to list assignments.

types.description: Represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.description: Contains grade information for a course or grading period

fields.name: currentScore
fields.description: The current score includes all graded assignments, excluding muted submissions.

fields.name: finalScore
fields.description:
The final score includes all assignments, excluding muted submissions
(ungraded assignments are counted as 0 points).

fields.name: overrideGrade
fields.description: The override grade. Supersedes the computed final grade if set.

fields.name: overrideScore
fields.description: The override score. Supersedes the computed final score if set.

fields.name: unpostedCurrentScore
fields.description: The current score includes all graded assignments, including muted submissions.

fields.name: unpostedFinalScore
fields.description:
The final score includes all assignments, including muted submissions
(ungraded assignments are counted as 0 points).

types.name: ID
types.description: Represents a unique identifier that is Base64 obfuscated. It is often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"VXNlci0xMA=="`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Int
types.description: Represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.description: Settings for Moderated Grading on an Assignment

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: Boolean indicating if the assignment is moderated.

fields.name: finalGrader
fields.description: The user of the grader responsible for choosing final grades for this assignment.

fields.name: graderCommentsVisibleToGraders
fields.description: Boolean indicating if provisional graders' comments are visible to other provisional graders.

fields.name: graderCount
fields.description: The maximum number of provisional graders who may issue grades for this assignment.

fields.name: graderNamesVisibleToFinalGrader
fields.description: Boolean indicating if provisional graders' identities are hidden from other provisional graders.

fields.name: gradersAnonymousToGraders
fields.description: Boolean indicating if provisional grader identities are visible to the final grader.

fields.description: List of Outcome Links that were sucessfully moved to the group

fields.name: createSubmission
fields.description: IN ACTIVE DEVELOPMENT, USE AT YOUR OWN RISK: Submit homework on an assignment.

fields.name: setAssignmentPostPolicy
fields.description: Sets the post policy for the assignment.

fields.name: setCoursePostPolicy
fields.description:
Sets the post policy for the course, with an option to override and delete
existing assignment post policies.

fields.name: setOverrideScore
fields.description:
Sets the overridden final score for the associated enrollment, optionally limited to a specific
grading period. This will supersede the computed final score/grade if present.

fields.name: realUser
fields.description:
If the mutation was performed by a user masquerading as another user,
this field returns the "real" (logged-in) user.

types.description: Context types that can be associated with notification preferences

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: Information about pagination in a connection.

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: When paginating forwards, the cursor to continue.

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: When paginating forwards, are there more items?

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: When paginating backwards, are there more items?

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: When paginating backwards, the cursor to continue.

fields.name: level
fields.description: This number (0-3) is intended to give an idea of how the student is doing relative to others in the course

fields.name: max
fields.description: The maximum number of views/participations in this course

fields.name: total
fields.description: The number of views/participations this student has

types.name: PeerReviews
types.description: Settings for Peer Reviews on an Assignment

fields.name: anonymousReviews
fields.description: Boolean representing whether or not peer reviews are anonymous

fields.name: automaticReviews
fields.description: Boolean indicating peer reviews are assigned automatically. If false, the teacher is expected to manually assign peer reviews.

fields.name: count
fields.description: Integer representing the amount of reviews each user is assigned.

fields.name: dueAt
fields.description: Date and Time representing when the peer reviews are due

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: Boolean indicating if peer reviews are required for this assignment

fields.name: intraReviews
fields.description: Boolean representing whether or not members from within the same group on a group assignment can be assigned to peer review their own group's work

types.name: PostPolicy
types.description:
A PostPolicy sets the policy for whether a Submission's grades are posted
automatically or manually. A PostPolicy can be set at the Course and/or
Assignment level.

types.name: SelfSignupPolicy
types.description:
Determines if/how a student may join a group. A student can belong to
only one group per group set at a time.

enumValues.name: enabled
enumValues.description: students may join any group

enumValues.name: restricted
enumValues.description: students may join a group in their section

enumValues.name: disabled
enumValues.description: self signup is not allowed

types.name: String
types.description: Represents textual data as UTF-8 character sequences. This type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: StudentSummaryAnalytics
types.description: basic information about a students activity in a course

inputFields.name: allComments
inputFields.description:
If all of the comments, regardless of the submission attempt, should be returned.
If this is true, the for_attempt argument will be ignored.

inputFields.name: forAttempt

it will return the comments for the current submisssion or submission history.

inputFields.name: userSearch
inputFields.description:
The partial name or full ID of the users to match and return in the
results list. Must be at least 3 characters.
Queries by administrative users will search on SIS ID, login ID, name, or email
address; non-administrative queries will only be compared against name.

inputFields.name: scoredLessThan
inputFields.description: Limit results to submissions that scored below the specified value

inputFields.name: scoredMoreThan
inputFields.description: Limit results to submissions that scored above the specified value

inputFields.name: late
inputFields.description: Limit results to submissions that are late

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
